root.name: OSman
root.description: OverviewOsman is a side-scrolling action game released in arcades in 1996. It was made by former Capcom employees who originally worked on Strider. As such, Osman was intended as a spiritual successor to Strider. It was renamed Cannon Dancer in being licensed to Atlus.In contrast to Strider's futuristic Kazakh-Soviet setting, Osman is set in a futuristic neon-lit cyberpunk Arabian Gulf setting (somewhat foreshadowing the rise of Dubai), while Strider Hiryu is replaced by a Middle-Eastern protagonist named Osman who fights bare-handed without any weapons, using a variety of kicks.
